Posts.Content: Sorry you've found yourself here, but we're all with you on this journey and will listen and help with all we can.  I have found this site a wonderful support.  As with going privately for treatment,  I did just that. I was misdiagnosed initially by the NHS and I needed to speak to someone else.  I'm glad I did it.  I didn't lose my NHS BCN either because they don't just write you off like that, it's classed as neglect if they do. I gained a better personal experience and I'm glad I did it. You'll know what to do when the time comes, sometimes I just couldn't manage if I thought too far into the future.  Take care of yourself  xxx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Beautiful,  I hope mine starts when I start T  At the moment mine hasn't fully gone and my scalp is sore so I don't think getting it shaved is an option at the moment ..... so I'm trending the Eric Morecambe comb over look!!!!  It's very fetching,  and it does make me laugh when I take my hat off  xxxxx
Posts.Title: Hair Loss - Question about regrowth.

Posts.Content: JammyR  You are my twin! We started our chemo journey on the same day, and we're having the same treatment . I have a son who is 8 and he could not wait to see my bald head!  I think that's the difference between boys and girls! I'm sure your daughter will be fine with it. I had shoulder long hair that started to come away on Day 10 of my first FEC and I had to have it all cut off as my scalp was so sore I couldn't get it shaved . I'm hoping like you that by summer they'll be a bit of coverage , but I would have never had a different style in my life.  I love those little pixie cuts , it might not suit me but I can't wait to have a go !! Hope you're doing ok chick .... it's a comfort to know we all feel the same  xx
Posts.Title: Hair Loss - Question about regrowth.

Posts.Content: Hi everyone. I've been lurking for a while, but I feel good.  Second round of FEC yesterday , felt terrible last night, but much better today .... let's wait until tomorrows rollercoaster haha..... Stay strong, this is a fab group and I love it and you all too. Have a good weekend xx
Posts.Title: 2nd FEC done.....

Posts.Content: Has anyone had an outbreak of spots due to Docetaxel?  Crikey, my face is a mess. Red, hot and itchy. I'm guessing it's another lovely side effect  xx
Posts.Title: Docetaxel Face Rash

Posts.Content: Kath50  This is my 2nd cycle with my 3rd and last on Thursday.  I am the same with aches and pains and have spoken to my nurse as the pain was bad where my surgery was . It is normal to get the pain there, as where the surgery was has not completely healed.  Hope you feel better soon. It is quite painful but it does ease with time xxx
Posts.Title: Docetaxel Face Rash

Posts.Content: I'm drinking tonic water with Elderflower,  it's so refreshing with a slice of lime or lemon. I also pretend that a great big slug of gin in it too..... but that's just me x
Posts.Title: Drink

Posts.Content: Put ice and lemon in it and close your eyes. ... heaven  lol xx
Posts.Title: Drink
